name: MARS AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT, Petitioner, v. UNITED PRESBYTERIAN WOMEN'S ASSOCIATION OF NORTH AMERICA, Respondent; MARS AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT, Petitioner, v. UNITED PRESBYTERIAN WOMEN'S ASSOCIATION OF NORTH AMERICA, County of Butler, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Mars Area School District v. United Presbyterian Women's Ass'n of North America

parties: MARS AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT, Petitioner, v. UNITED PRESBYTERIAN WOMEN’S ASSOCIATION OF NORTH AMERICA, Respondent. MARS AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT, Petitioner, v. UNITED PRESBYTERIAN WOMEN’S ASSOCIATION OF NORTH AMERICA, County of Butler, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 22nd day of May, 1998, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is hereby GRANTED. Oral argument will be limited to the following issue:
Whether the Commonwealth. Court and the Court of Common Pleas erred in finding that UPWA qualified as a purely public charity in that UPWA relieved the government of some of its burden.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
710 A.2d 1137
MARS AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT, Petitioner, v. UNITED PRESBYTERIAN WOMEN’S ASSOCIATION OF NORTH AMERICA, Respondent. MARS AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT, Petitioner, v. UNITED PRESBYTERIAN WOMEN’S ASSOCIATION OF NORTH AMERICA, County of Butler, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
May 22, 1998.
